channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10212] New rpc metric: number of active handler
item.description:
The attached patch adds a new metric: number of active handler threads. We found this is a good metric to measure how busy of a server. If this number is too high (compared to the total number of handlers), the server has risks in getting call queue full.

We used to monitor # reads or # writes. However we found this often produce false alerts, because a read touching HDFS will produce much high workload than a block-cached read.

The attached patch is based on our internal 0.94 branch, but I think it pretty easy to port to rebase to other branches if you think it is useful.
item.summary: New rpc metric: number of active handler

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Very useful indeed. I was thinking about adding this myself.
Do you have a patch?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12619767/hbase-10212.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12619767

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8257//console

This message is automatically generated.
Is there such a metric in trunk Elliott Clark? If not, I could forward port. Sounds useful.

The attached file could apply to 0.94 branch directly w/o any change
+1
There isn't currently a metric that's the same. It could be useful as long as it's not too costly.

Let's get this into 0.94.17

Ted Yu, so this is for 0.94 only?
Make a forward port jira, stack?
Lemme just commit this here so that I can spin a new RC soon. Let's a forward port jira for 0.96+.
